definition: (Tw) to take over sb's job/to substitute for
to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon
surname Ban
team/class/squad/work shift/ranking/CL:個|个[ge4]/classifier for groups

sentences.english: I'll cover for you while you're in Europe.
sentences.chinese: 你在歐洲時，我會幫你代班的。

sentences.english: Associated Press, other search and rescue team members will give them "on behalf of the class."
sentences.chinese: 美聯社報道，其他搜救隊員將爲他們“代班”。

sentences.english: He asked me if I could cover a co-worker's shift from 4:00 PM until midnight.
sentences.chinese: 他問我能不能替同事代班，從下午4時到午夜。

definition: to act as substitute/to fill in for sb
to take over sb else's job/to substitute for
to save the show (for instance by stepping in for an absent actor)
to request leave of absence
to change shift/the next work shift/to relieve (a workman on the previous shift)/to take over the job
to teach as substitute for absent teacher
(Tw) teacher in charge of a class/homeroom teacher
day laborer/temporary work
early shift/morning work shift
to arrange (shifts, runs, classes etc) in order
to work one's shift
to hold concurrent posts/concurrent job/moonlighting
day shift
to replace sb on a workshift/to substitute for
Happy Camp (PRC TV series)
shift working
